name: the-last-hunter

story.title: System: Reawakening
story.logline: Betrayed in a dungeon and left for dead, the world's weakest hunter unlocks a unique interface that turns reality into a game where he alone can level up.
themes: The cruelty of the strong against the weak
story.synopsis: In a world where strength is fixed at awakening, Jin-woo is the 'World's Weakest Hunter,' risking his life in low-rank dungeons to pay for his mother's life-support. During a raid on a D-Rank dungeon, his party stumbles into a hidden 'Double Dungeon'—a terrifying temple filled with god-like statues. The raid leader, Kang, betrays the group to escape, leaving Jin-woo and a timid healer named Hana to die. As a massive stone statue brings its blade down, a holographic screen freezes time: [You have met the hidden requirements. Will you accept the Player role?]. Jin-woo accepts, escaping death but waking up in a hospital three days later. Now, he sees 'Quests' floating in the air. To survive the penalties and save his mother, he must enter an 'Instance Dungeon' located inside a subway station and kill the boss, transforming from prey into the ultimate predator.

story_beats.description: Opening Panel: Extreme close-up of Jin-woo's eye, pupil dilated, reflecting a massive stone blade descending. Text overlay: 'I died today.' Cut to 1 hour earlier: The party entering the ominous Double Dungeon.

The statues activate. It is a massacre. Kang (the leader) realizes the only way out is a sacrifice. He kicks Jin-woo's leg, breaking it, and flees. As the statue swings to kill Jin-woo, the System Screen appears: [ACCEPT ROLE?]. He presses YES. Blackout.

Jin-woo wakes in a hospital. He thinks he hallucinated, but a 'Daily Quest' screen appears demanding 100 push-ups or face a 'Penalty.' He fails on purpose to test it and is transported to a 'Penalty Zone' (a desert with giant centipedes) for 4 hours. He survives by the skin of his teeth, realizing this is real. He receives a 'Loot Box' containing a key to an Instance Dungeon.

Jin-woo enters the Instance Dungeon (Hapjeong Subway Station). It is filled with steel-fanged wolves. He is still weak, using his wits and the environment (turnstiles, narrow corridors) to separate them. He kills one, and a golden light surrounds him: [LEVEL UP]. His broken leg heals instantly.

The Dungeon Boss appears: The Blue Venom Lycan. It's faster than him. Jin-woo's dagger snaps. He is pinned down, the Lycan's jaws inches from his face. He remembers his mother's hospital bill. Rage triggers a hidden skill: [Sprint]. He maneuvers behind the Lycan and strangles it with the broken dagger hilt, leveling up mid-fight to boost his strength stat enough to snap its neck.

Jin-woo stands over the dissolving boss body. He is covered in blood but standing tall. He opens his status window. Name: Sung Jin-woo. Level: 5. He looks at his hand, clenching a fist. The blue system light reflects in his eyes. 'I can get stronger.' End of Season 1 Arc.

characters.name: Sung Jin-woo

description.physical: Lean, scarred body, sharp jawline but exhausted eyes. Initially has bad posture that straightens as he levels up.
description.personality: Resilient, observant, protective, initially timid but becomes cold and calculated in combat.
description.background: Known as the 'E-Rank hunter who gets hurt in every raid.' Father is missing, mother has 'Eternal Slumber' disease.
description.motivation: Money for mother's medical bills; survival.

chapters.title: The Double Dungeon
chapters.summary: In the depths of a D-Rank dungeon, Sung Jin-woo faces imminent death. A flashback reveals how his party stumbled into the Cartenon Temple, a hidden chamber that traps them inside with ancient, terrifying statues.

scenes.description: The climax of the failed raid. Dust fills the air, mixed with the metallic scent of blood. The massive chamber is dimly lit by eerie blue flames.

panels.action: Focus on Jin-woo's right eye. The pupil is dilated to the max, trembling. Reflecting in his iris is a massive stone sword descending rapidly.
panels.continuity_note: High contrast lighting, extreme detail on the eye.

panels.action: A massive stone statue, resembling a cruel god, fills the frame. It is swinging a sword down towards the viewer (Jin-woo). The scale is overwhelming.
panels.continuity_note: The reflection from panel 1 is now the reality.

panels.action: Jin-woo's face is covered in dust and blood. He looks up, frozen, realizing there is no escape. Time seems to slow down.
panels.continuity_note: Blood trickling down forehead.

panels.action: Impact frame. The screen goes mostly black with kinetic impact lines. The sound of crushing stone dominates.
panels.continuity_note: Violent transition.

panels.action: Pitch black panel. Just white text in the center.
panels.continuity_note: Time skip transition.

scenes.description: The party is walking through the entrance tunnel of the dungeon. It is damp, dark, and ancient. They are approaching the double doors.

panels.action: The hunting party walks down a long, torch-lit corridor. Hwang Kang leads confidently. Jin-woo trails behind, carrying a large backpack of supplies.

dialogue.text: Tch. Why did the Association send us an E-Rank? He's just dead weight.

panels.continuity_note: Jin-woo looks physically smaller/weaker than the others.

panels.action: Lee Hana slows down to walk beside Jin-woo. She glows with a faint healing light, offering a kind smile.

dialogue.text: Don't listen to him, Mr. Sung. Are you hurt from the last fight?

panels.continuity_note: Hana's staff emits soft light.

panels.action: Jin-woo looks down, gripping the strap of his heavy bag. He looks tired and resigned.

dialogue.text: I'm used to it. I need the raid money for my mother's hospital bills...

panels.continuity_note: Background fades to show his isolation.

panels.action: The group stops in front of a massive pair of double doors. The doors are intricately carved with ominous designs.

dialogue.text: Jackpot. This hasn't been looted yet. We're going to be rich.

panels.continuity_note: The doors loom over them.

panels.action: Jin-woo stares at the door handles. He feels a chill. A subtle visual effect of 'shivering' lines around him.

dialogue.text: Wait... something feels wrong. The air is too heavy.

panels.continuity_note: Atmosphere shifts to colder tones.

panels.action: Hwang Kang pushes the heavy doors open with a grunt. Darkness spills out from the gap.

dialogue.text: Quit whining, weakling. We're going in.

panels.continuity_note: Dust falls from the door frame.

scenes.description: Inside the main chamber. The scale is immense. Giant statues line the walls. The atmosphere shifts from exploration to entrapment.

panels.action: Establishing shot of the interior. It is a coliseum-sized room. Statues of hooded figures holding instruments and weapons line the walls. At the far end sits the main Statue of God.
panels.continuity_note: The humans are tiny dots in comparison.

panels.action: Jin-woo is looking around nervously. He spots a tablet with inscriptions near the center.
panels.continuity_note: Lighting is currently dim/natural torchlight.

panels.action: Sudden sharp sound. The heavy doors they entered through slam shut with incredible force.
panels.continuity_note: Dust cloud from the door.

panels.action: Hwang Kang rushes to the door and tries to pull it open. It doesn't budge. He looks back, angry.

dialogue.text: What the hell? It won't open!

panels.continuity_note: Panic starts to set in.

panels.action: The torches lining the walls suddenly flare to life, but the fire is an unnatural, sickly blue. The shadows lengthen and distort.
panels.continuity_note: Color palette shift: Warm/Brown -> Cold/Blue.

panels.action: Focus on the eyes of the main Statue of God. They shift. The stone pupil moves to look directly at the party.
panels.continuity_note: The start of the horror.

chapters.title: The First Commandment
chapters.summary: Trapped in the Cartenon Temple, the raid party is decimated by the awakening statues. In a moment of desperation, Hwang Kang betrays Sung Jin-woo to secure his own escape. Left for dead as the God Statue descends, Jin-woo receives a mysterious system prompt.

scenes.description: The massive stone doors have slammed shut. The blue flames of the torches flare violently, casting long, dancing shadows. The atmosphere has shifted from ancient mystery to active malice.
The chaos of the massacre. Dust and debris fill the air. The survivors are scrambling toward the exit, but the statues are faster.

panels.action: Hwang Kang stops running, looking back at the pursuing stone guard. He looks at the heavy stone door that is slowly closing.

dialogue.text: It's too fast. We can't all make it through the gap.

panels.continuity_note: Kang is sweating heavily, armor dented.

panels.action: Kang grabs Jin-woo by the collar. A dark shadow falls over his face.

dialogue.text: Someone needs to draw its aggro, Mr. Sung.

panels.action: Kang's heavy boot stomps directly onto Jin-woo's right knee.
Jin-woo collapses to the floor, clutching his leg. Kang shoves him backward toward the approaching statue.
Lee Hana tries to turn back, tears streaming, but Kang drags her through the closing gap in the door.
Jin-woo is left alone in the center of the vast chamber. The door shuts completely. He is small and broken against the cold stone floor.
panels.continuity_note: The lighting drops significantly as the door shuts.

scenes.description: The climax. Time seems to slow down. The God Statue moves to deliver the killing blow.

panels.action: POV from Jin-woo looking up. The massive God Statue looms directly overhead, a stone tablet raised to crush him.

dialogue.text: So... this is it. Used and thrown away again.

panels.action: Jin-woo's face is bloodied. He stares death in the face, not with fear, but with resentment.

dialogue.text: If I had one more chance...

panels.action: Just as the stone descends, the world turns grey (motion stop). A holographic blue window pops into existence in front of Jin-woo's face.
panels.continuity_note: The dust particles in the air are frozen.

panels.action: Focus on the System text. It glows with an ethereal light.

dialogue.text: [SECRET QUEST UNLOCKED: COURAGE OF THE WEAK]
You have acquired the qualifications to become a 'Player'. Will you accept?

panels.action: Jin-woo reaches out with a trembling, bloody hand.
A blinding white light explodes from the panel, engulfing Jin-woo and the descending stone weapon. The screen goes completely white.
panels.continuity_note: End of chapter hook.

chapters.title: The Player
chapters.summary: Jin-woo wakes up in a hospital, his injuries miraculously healed. Skeptical of a mysterious 'System' interface only he can see, he ignores a daily quest and is punished by being transported to a deadly desert penalty zone. Upon surviving, he realizes this power is real and receives a key to a hidden dungeon.

scenes.description: Jin-woo wakes up in a clean, white hospital room. The horror of the dungeon is replaced by blinding sunlight and the smell of antiseptic.

panels.action: Jin-woo's eyes snap open. The frame is flooded with harsh white light, blurring the edges of his vision.
panels.continuity_note: Immediate transition from the darkness of the previous chapter's death scene.

panels.action: Jin-woo sits up violently in the hospital bed, his hands frantically grasping at his right leg—the one that was severed in the dungeon.

dialogue.text: My leg... the statue... where is it?!

panels.continuity_note: He is wearing a standard patient gown.

panels.action: POV shot looking down at his legs. Both are perfectly intact under the thin blanket. There isn't even a scar.

dialogue.text: It's... fine? Was it a dream?

panels.continuity_note: Legs are fully healed.

panels.action: A semi-transparent blue hologram abruptly materializes in the air right in front of Jin-woo's face.
panels.continuity_note: The blue light of the screen reflects in his eyes.

panels.action: Focus on the screen interface. It lists 'Daily Quest: Strength Training' with a list: Push-ups (0/100), Sit-ups (0/100), Running (0/10km).

dialogue.text: WARNING: Failure to complete within the time limit will result in a Penalty.
A game interface? I must have hit my head harder than I thought.

panels.continuity_note: Text is crisp and digital.

panels.action: Jin-woo lies back down, pulling the covers up, ignoring the floating screen hovering persistently above his bed.

dialogue.text: I'm going back to sleep. This hallucination can deal with itself.

panels.continuity_note: The screen remains glowing in the air.

scenes.description: The transition from the safety of the hospital to the penalty zone. The consequences of ignoring the system become real.

panels.action: The digital clock on the hologram hits 00:00:00. The light in the room shifts from the cool blue of night to an alarming, strobe-light red.
panels.continuity_note: Time skip to night.

panels.action: Jin-woo is jolted awake as the hospital bed dissolves into digital particles beneath him. Gravity shifts.
panels.continuity_note: The environment is actively glitching.

panels.action: Abrupt cut. Jin-woo is standing in an endless desert of red sand. The sky is purple. A massive, scorching sun beats down.

dialogue.text: Hot... it's incredibly hot. This isn't the hospital.

panels.continuity_note: He is still in his hospital gown, barefoot on the sand.

panels.action: Jin-woo's bare foot sinks into the burning sand. He winces.

dialogue.text: The heat... the grit... it's too detailed for a dream.

panels.continuity_note: Visual heat haze effect.

panels.action: Behind Jin-woo, a massive dune explodes outward. A Giant Centipede (size of a bus) rears up, mandibles clicking.
panels.continuity_note: Jin-woo is turning around, eyes wide.

panels.action: Jin-woo starts running, sweat pouring down his face, terror in his eyes. The shadow of the monster looms over him.

dialogue.text: It's real! If I get caught, I die!

panels.continuity_note: Motion blur to indicate speed.

scenes.description: Jin-woo returns from the penalty zone, battered but alive. He accepts the reality of the System and receives his first item.

panels.action: Jin-woo crashes onto the tiled floor of the hospital room. He is covered in red sand, his gown torn, gasping for air.
panels.continuity_note: The room is back to normal, but the sand on the floor proves he went somewhere.

panels.action: Jin-woo stares at his trembling hands. They are dirty and scraped. He clenches a fist.

dialogue.text: It's not a hallucination. This 'System' has control over my life.

panels.continuity_note: Lighting is dim hospital night lighting.

panels.action: The System window pops up again with a cheerful chime.
A small, glowing 'Loot Box' icon floats in the air. Jin-woo reaches out and taps it tentatively.
The box opens with a golden light. An old-fashioned iron key materializes in his hand.
Focus on the key. The item description box appears next to it.
panels.continuity_note: The key glows faintly, promising a new path.

original_prompt: Jin-woo is the weakest E-rank hunter in a world where mysterious gates opened 10 years ago, unleashing monsters. After his entire raid party is wiped out in a hidden double dungeon, he alone survives and awakens a unique power - a system that only he can see, allowing him to level up like a video game character. He must grow stronger to protect his sick mother and uncover the truth behind the gates.
